A rich country like USA pays only $1099 (Rs. 81,500) whereas its priced a whopping Rs. 48,400 more in India. Thats slmost 60% more. Shame!

The upgrade does provide you with enhanced durability, performance and looks!

Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


  ¬†Apple‚Äôs latest flagship makes useful advances over its predecessor in almost every way. Image quality is very good, autofocus is lightning fast and accurate, detail is high, and colors are generally pleasant. Apple remains a leader in preview performance, so what you see when composing a shot looks a lot like the final result. Dynamic range could be better, but mobile photographers should be pleased overall.This iPhone‚Äôs weakest link is its lack of long zoom capability, something we‚Äôre seeing more of in flagships from the competition. If reach is paramount to you, then there are other phones that excel in this metric (but none that run iOS).Video performance overall is excellent, just short of the best we‚Äôve seen. Wide dynamic range, good color, low noise, and effective stabilization make this iPhone a good choice for users who prioritize video capabilities.For mobile photographers committed to the iOS ecosystem and ready to part with the hefty purchase price, the iPhone 12 Pro Max shouldn‚Äôt disappoint.

Review Title: Currently the best phone Apple makes
Reviews: This is the ‚Äòall we can do‚Äô offering of iPhone from Apple in 2020. The phone runs smooth and fast, as expected. A14 Bionic crushes everything you can throw at it with it keeping apps open in the background with zero issues. The battery lasts all day. The camera is amazing and it‚Äôs quite a big improvement coming from an iPhone 7 Plus. The screen is vibrant and the speakers sound like a good quality Bluetooth speaker. The pacific blue color is beautiful as well. Looks like grey in certain lighting. However, since this is the biggest iPhone Apple has ever made, I would recommend holding the phone in person before buying as this phone is huge & some people can find it uncomfortable at 6.7 inches. Many people can get 90% of what this phone offers in the smaller 12 Pro. That being said, if you want the biggest screen, the biggest battery on an iPhone and as long as you know what you‚Äôre getting into with the size, and you have the money to spend, would recommend this phone 10/10.

Review Title: Most luxury defining indulgence in a smartphone ever.

There are several reviews out there to help you decide whether or not to get this phone.I‚Äôd totally recommend this to anyone out there who‚Äôs looking for the best possible investment in a smartphone, considering money‚Äôs not an issue.That 1% of people who are going to buy this phone will get their money‚Äôs worth over a considerable amount of time.It delivers great real estate in terms of a huge display and bigger battery. Delivering benchmark quality in every single aspect.So yeah, all in all an extremely worthy buy if you can afford that kind of money for a phone. Also, that Pacific Blue finish is by far the most elegant piece of art in a smartphone ever. Takes it to the next level in terms of look and feel. Review Title: THE BEST Phone That Money Can Buy ! (coming from an Android lover)
Reviews: We all heard rumors about several stuffs but at the end of the day iPhone 12 Pro Max manages to surprise me every now and then. Be it the built quality, application optimization, display, brightness, smoothness or even battery life. I have switched from Android to iPhone of late and the experience has been pretty good. The more secure platform gives you all that you need, to do serious business. You can do countless number of things on this device if you are features centric or specs oriented. Lastly, the camera module, as you all know, mqnages to deliver highest output if you want. I agree that many devices can have mind boggling numbers, bigger than this iPhone, on paper but having numbers and delivering results are two different aspects of it. If you are willing to spend this much amount of money, reliability factor comes into the picture.I was confused whether to buy Samsung Galaxy S21 Ultra or iPhone 12 Pro Max but at the end, I stick to my decision of buying iPhone 12 Pro Max. One of the very important reason of it being reliable. Buying an android might save you some bucks or even give you access to countless features but you have to think hard if you will be really needing those. I mean, don't get me wrong, we all have our own perspectives but coming from an hardcore Android lover, this opinion of mine should give you some broader view.I know that many think that Apple is little over hyped brand but let me tell you something, it will really amaze you when you actually buy one. This is my first iPhone and I am more than just happy with the product.Lastly, I should add one sentence to this review which is what you are trying to find all over the section.The question coming into your mind right now is if it is worth it.The answer is, absolutely YES ! It surely is WORTH IT.But, you won't know if you have never experienced such stuff. So, go for it if you are thinking hard as I did.Having an iPhone makes a whole lot of difference rather than owning an Android flagship. Android flagships lose their weight the moment next flagship is launched after a year or so, but if you are buying this phone, you can easily stick with it more than 5 years of timeframe or so what the device will start hinting you the moment you touch it.Trust me. I was an Android lover and has regretted previously buying phones those were not.But, the truth is that iPhones are not one of them and iOS is simply better optimized for user experience than Android. It is customer centric and not for business.

Review Title: First time iphone user review - an Android user‚Äôs perspective
Reviews: First impression: Awesome product! I mean the hardware and the overall built quality, screen display, body material etc.Now the pain start when I need to migrate my backup of android phone. Eventually took the help of a paid app to migrate all my Whatsapp content without any hassle. Rest all the photos n videos have been migrated but in random order.Now coming from an android phone, I find that iOS has few limitation in terms of customisation and is very basic. Moreover, a simple process of checking and forwarding a message takes few more steps in iOS than in android, making a simple task complex. This makes me feel iOS is few years behind android in developing its UI. This is the only pain point I m currently facing. Moreover, most of apps that are free in android google play store are paid in apple app store and paid ones are even more costly for iOS.Now the highlight is obviously the camera. So far I have tested few night shots and boy!! am really impressed with the final outcome of the shots. One I have attached here for future buyers‚Äô reference. Portrait shots too are excellent. Ohh!! I forgot to mention about the inbuilt photo editing software of iOS. It has all the basic necessary tools to edit the photos then n there only. Recently, I have learned how to take a dreamy shot of waterfall with a Live camera option. Earlier that type of picture can be taken from a DSLR + ND filters on a tripod with long exposure shot. Now that shot can be taken handheld with this camera and boom!! you can make a dreamy long exposure shot in a matter of a second. Also downloaded few more editing apps such as Adobe PS express and Lightroom, and I can literally forget my DSLR and Laptop for a long time unless I require some heavy creative photography.Lastly, battery life is very good and it lasted me whole day with my heavy uses since I need to check and learn all the time, exploring the possibilities and potential of this beast. Charging too is very fast and 80% can be achieved in 30mins; then it slow down till 100%, which is ok for me. Till date no phone heating issue is observed while charging or during heavy uses. A14 chip works smoothly without any lag or hang as of now though I have not stressed it that far to rightly comment on that matter.Final verdict: Its an amazing product no doubt, but we in India are paying approx 50k more in taxes & duties to buy one if you compare the price outside of India - a pain point for person who looks for value for money product.
Nothing to dislike!! This thing is a beast..in love with its design it looks perfect in hands !!

Review Title: There is no phone like iphone
Reviews: One of the best phone ever. Seamless performance no hick ups. Optical zoom is better than most other. Night photos are as good as daytime ones. Battery lasts a day on normal usage without playing games. Optional wireless charger is good n hopefully they will bring the fast charging ones soon. Bit pricy but well worth every penny.

Out of Five StarsBattery Life ****Screen ****Performance *****Sound *****Overall 4.5 StarsI have been using iPhone starting from 4s, 5s, 6s, 8 Plus and now iPhone 12 Pro Max. Transition is huge I must say. It‚Äôs fairly fast when I compare my 8 plus for obvious reason. Fast charging, battery back up, screen resolution, performance, Camera performance is top notch. I have seen so many reviews on YouTube and everyone kind of liked the phone but there is a very small difference between the performance of all iPhone 12 variants.  Definitely with naked eye comparing the performance is very difficult but for me it make sense because the chipset is same but capability wise every variant is different but still apple managed to match the performance and based on the requirement or specifications people are choosing their own iPhone 12 variant. With the same chipset and various capabilities across the variants the phone does not seem to give any performance issue.Overall my feedback is, definitely this mobile is capable enough but the price is not justified even if I got 14k discount.

Review Title: Justifies the Premium Price that it deserves
Reviews: Before buying this everybody knows its premium and takes more money than a normal smartphone.The reason for the premium cost is iPhone really long last and gets regular iOS updates.Switched from 1+ Android to iPhone Pro Max. Used 5% full cash back using Amazon ICICI card instead and got around 6K instead of HDFC card max Rs 1750 instant discount.Every one knows the Pros. But I will highlight few issues and Bad about iPhones.1. Packaging was perfect. After a day of setup I noticed a small gap at the top right corner between panel and Contacted Apple support for the same and confirm its not defective.Google' d about this and many iPhone, iPads has this gap for various/Obvious reasons.2. No Charger and also Quick charge is not Quick (just for battery longevity).3. App migration is easy  but not smooth as switching from iOS to android4. Still stuck with WhatsApp migration (due to WhatsApp encryption its not straight away).5. Apple support via chat / phone is really excellent6. Heavy on Hand and wallet :-)Overall Android user will find it bit difficult to adapt iOS for a short time..

Model: iPhone 12 Pro Max (256GB) - Pacific BlueAs always, it packs with the best display, best camera and best interface.But the battery backup is the cherry on the cake, the trolls for iPhone battery issues will finally come to an end.The only issue I am facing is the lack of touch id, as face id doesn't work with the mask on, even on trying with the multiple ways as shown on the internet.Overall it is a perfect super-phone.If anyone have a  budget, iPhone 12 pro max is the one, you should go for.

Review Title: The best iPhone with the best design
Reviews: I have been into apple ecosystem since iPhone 4s.Since Apple started to move to larger displays they eventually let go the square design which I was missing a lot and did not hope that It ll ever comeback.The time when I saw they are bringing back the squared flat design I was blown away.I pre-ordered from Amazon as soon as it was available.Thanks to amazon I got the delivery on 14th.As soon as I unboxed it I was like wow.The phone feels ultra premium in hand with stainless steel borders and matte finish back.The display lives upto the standards of Apple.Battery life is at par with last year iPhones,though on paper it has a smaller battery.Coming to the camera samples it is again the best camera in a smartphone curretly.The 10bit HDR video is amazing.They have incorporated sensor shift stabilization which I am yet to test.Some of the pros and cons :Pros :DesignLow light camera shotsHDR VideoBattery lifeA14 5nm bionic chipCons:Price is relatively high compared to other marketsNo Charging adapter(might be a huge letdown for people newly moving to iOS)No high refresh rate displays(Although the display does not feel slow )What I felt :I upgraded from 11 Pro Max.For an average user you ll not find a huge difference in terms of overall usage and experience.The size might not be a fit for everyone since its really huge.I am yet to test the magsafe accessories as these aren't available on Amazon yet.So if some one looking to upgrade from iPhone XS or older ,will be a huge upgrade in terms of camera ,performance,battery life etc.Overall,its actually the best iPhone with the all time fav design WITH AN ULTRA PRO MAX PREMIUM COST :p(I ll add camera samples and edit this review after few months of usage)

Review Title: Best phone ever with huge price.
Reviews: Best phone but price is a bit high

I‚Äôve been an android user forever and very honestly this is my first iPhone ever. Are there things that can be better, definitely there are and there will always be. That being said is this one of the best phones I‚Äôve ever had, I would say definitely yes. Everything about it is very intuitive, fast and well put together. Could this phone have been more reasonably priced, definitely yes but no one flashed their iPhones or ‚Äúi‚Äù anything because they were so cheap to buy and maintain. There are a lot of things done well and a couple of them are the camera and battery, yes you heard me right the battery in this phone is amazing. I am a heavy user my screen remains on for the better part of 8-10 hours a day and I get on an average 30-45 calls everyday but I end up charging this phone only once in 2 days.
